line_1: From the stain'd Rock he sucks the pois'nous Heaps,
line_2: Feels his returning Strength, and hissing leaps;

line_1: Battens on Sands, or hides in slimy Heaps;
line_2: All the bright gladsome Hours he sullen Sleeps,

line_1: So when the Stag breaths on the guilty Heaps,
line_2: Where hid from Cold the wily Serpent sleeps,

line_1: Nor dares to hiss, but hides in weedy Heaps.
line_2: Silent below the meaner Serpent creeps,

line_1: With hollow vaulted Cells, and rising Heaps
line_2: In which by Day the weary'd Badger sleeps.

line_1: And with new Slime besmears the sandy Heaps.
line_2: The Tide swells on the Shore, and forward creeps,
